alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:37AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT/515 AM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN DALE...SOUTHERN HENRY...NORTHEASTERN GENEVA AND HOUSTON COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA...WESTERN MILLER...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...SOUTHWESTERN CALHOUN...EARLY AND NORTHWESTERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 536 AM EDT/436 AM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Fort Gaines to near Columbia to near Taylor, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Dothan, Blakely, Headland, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Arlington, Webb, Columbia, Pinckard, Centerville, Malvern, Rehobeth, Grimes, Avon and Napier Field. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
